title: Rocket Lab to launch European navigation tech demo satellites
summary:
Rocket Lab will launch a pair of European navigation technology demonstration satellites, as Europe again is forced to look outside the continent for launch services.

title: Waning Crescent Moon
summary: NASA astronaut Bob Hines took this picture of the waning crescent moon on May 8, 2022, as the International Space Station flew into an orbital sunrise 260 miles above the Atlantic Ocean off the northwest coast of the United States. title: NASA-Assisted Scientists Get Bird’s-Eye View of Population Status
summary: NASA satellite data and citizen science observations combine for new findings on bird populations.

title: What Are Asteroids? (Ages 14-18)
summary: What are asteroids? Asteroids are rocky objects that orbit the Sun just like planets do. In fact, sometimes asteroids are called “minor planets.” These space rocks were left behind after our solar system formed about 4.6 billion years ago. Asteroids are found in a wide range of sizes. For example, one small asteroid, 2015 TC25, […]

title: John Casani, Former Manager of Multiple NASA Missions, Dies
summary: During his work on several historic missions, Casani rose through a series of technical and management positions, making an indelible mark on the nation’s space program.   John R. title: Isar Aerospace raises 150 million euros
summary:
German launch vehicle startup Isar Aerospace has raised 150 million euros ($174 million) in the form of a convertible bond from an American investor.
The post Isar Aerospace raises 150 million euros appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 27 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission comes as SpaceX continues to ferry four astronauts to the International Space Station on Axiom Mission 4, which launched in the predawn hours. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at 3:03 p.m. EDT (1903 UTC).

title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Scours Mars for Science
summary: In addition to drilling rock core samples, the science team has been grinding its way into rocks to make sense of the scientific evidence hiding just below the surface.
